Exaggerate: The claim made by President Trump exaggerates the cleanliness of the United States compared to other countries.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the United States is the cleanest country in the world.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts rankings compiled by researchers at Yale and Columbia universities, which show that the United States is not the cleanest country and ranks 27th out of 180 countries in terms of environmental performance.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that getting rid of certain rules and regulations will lead to a cleaner environment without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that there are several countries that are cleaner than the United States, both overall and in specific categories, according to the Environmental Performance Index.
